in_ports.description: Two ports for max operation. Indexed from 0 to 1.
in_ports.name: IN[2]

out_ports.description: Maximum value between IN[0] and IN[1].
out_ports.name: OUT

in_ports.description: Two ports for min operation. Indexed from 0 to 1.
in_ports.name: IN[2]

out_ports.description: Minimum value between IN[0] and IN[1].
out_ports.name: OUT

types.description: Calculates absolute value of a number.

in_ports.description: Input number.
in_ports.name: IN

types.name: int/abs

out_ports.description: Number's absolute value.
out_ports.name: OUT

types.description: Increment or decrement it's internal value by 'step' whenever a packet is received and outputs the updated value. If the internal value is greater than 'max' after an increment, it's set to min and an empty packet is sent through OVERFLOW port as well, or if it's less than 'min' after a decrement, it's set to 'max' and an empty packet is sent through UNDERFLOW port.

in_ports.description: Increment operation.
in_ports.name: INC

in_ports.description: Decrement operation.
in_ports.name: DEC

in_ports.description: Reset accumulator to its initial state.
in_ports.name: RESET

in_ports.description: Set accumulator value. This will issue a new output packet if the value is different than the accumulator's current state at the time.
in_ports.name: SET

types.name: int/accumulator

members.description: Range and step to be used in operations. Only positive step values are allowed.
members.name: setup_value

members.description: The initial value. An initial packet will be sent with this value.
members.name: initial_value

members.description: If true, a packet containing initial value will be sent during initialization
members.name: send_initial_packet

out_ports.description: Updated value after an input is processed.
out_ports.name: OUT

out_ports.description: Sends an empty package whenever an overflow happens.
out_ports.name: OVERFLOW

out_ports.description: Sends an empty package whenever an underflow happens.
out_ports.name: UNDERFLOW

in_ports.description: Thirty two ports for addition operation. Indexed from 0 to 31. Results are sent after at least one packet is received on each connected port.
in_ports.name: OPERAND[32]

out_ports.description: Sum of values received on ports OPERAND[0] to OPERAND[31].
out_ports.name: OUT

in_ports.description: Receives dividend value.
in_ports.name: DIVIDEND

in_ports.description: Receives divisor value.
in_ports.name: DIVISOR

out_ports.description: Quotient from the division of DIVIDEND by DIVISOR.
out_ports.name: OUT

in_ports.description: Receives dividend value.
in_ports.name: DIVIDEND

in_ports.description: Receives divisor value.
in_ports.name: DIVISOR

out_ports.description: Remainder from the division of DIVIDEND by DIVISOR.
out_ports.name: OUT

in_ports.description: Thirty two ports for multiplication operation. Indexed from 0 to 31. Results are sent after at least one packet is received on each connected port.
in_ports.name: OPERAND[32]

out_ports.description: Product of values received on ports OPERAND[0] and OPERAND[31].
out_ports.name: OUT

in_ports.description: Receives minuend value.
in_ports.name: MINUEND

in_ports.description: Receives subtrahend value.
in_ports.name: SUBTRAHEND

out_ports.description: Difference of values received on ports OPERAND[0] to OPERAND[31].
out_ports.name: OUT

in_ports.description: Two ports for AND operation. Indexed from 0 to 1.
in_ports.name: IN[2]

out_ports.description: The result of a bitwise AND between IN[0] and IN[1]
out_ports.name: OUT

in_ports.description: First port of NOT operation.
in_ports.name: IN

out_ports.description: Bitwise NOT of the value received in IN.
out_ports.name: OUT

in_ports.description: Two ports for OR operation. Indexed from 0 to 1.
in_ports.name: IN[2]

out_ports.description: The result of a bitwise OR between IN[0] and IN[1]
out_ports.name: OUT

in_ports.description: Value to be shifted
in_ports.name: IN

in_ports.description: Number of bits to shift the value in IN (must be less than 32)
in_ports.name: SHIFT

out_ports.description: The value received in IN, shifted SHIFT bits to the left.
out_ports.name: OUT

in_ports.description: Value to be shifted (it's assumed to be unsigned)
in_ports.name: IN

in_ports.description: Number of bits to shift the value in IN (must be less than 32)
in_ports.name: SHIFT

out_ports.description: The value received in IN, shifted SHIFT bits to the right (No sign extension).
out_ports.name: OUT

in_ports.description: Two ports for XOR operation. Indexed from 0 to 1.
in_ports.name: IN[2]

out_ports.description: The result of a bitwise XOR between IN[0] xor IN[1]
out_ports.name: OUT

types.description: Apply desired computation when buffer fills or timeout happens.

in_ports.description: Input port.
in_ports.name: IN

in_ports.description: Receives an int packet to set the timeout time to be used.
in_ports.name: TIMEOUT

in_ports.description: Reset buffer and timer to its initial state.
in_ports.name: RESET

types.name: int/buffer

members.description: Number of samples that the buffer should hold.
members.name: samples

members.description: Timeout time in milliseconds. Default is zero which means that timeout is disabled.
members.name: timeout

members.description: Operation to be applied in the buffer elements to compute the output. Supported operations: mean and median.
members.name: operation

members.description: If enabled, it will work just like a circular buffer, so after samples ammount is reached it will send a new packet every time a new value is received, reusing last received values. If set to false, after a packet is sent it needs to wait for all samples again (or timeout) since it resets the buffer when samples ammount is reached.
members.name: circular

out_ports.description: Output port.
out_ports.name: OUT

types.description: Check if an int is equal to other.

in_ports.description: Two ports for equal comparison operation. Indexed from 0 to 1.
in_ports.name: IN[2]

types.name: int/equal

out_ports.description: True if value received on port IN[0] is equal to value received on port IN[1].
out_ports.name: OUT

types.description: Check if an int is greater than other.

in_ports.description: Two ports for greater comparison operation. Indexed from 0 to 1, and IN[0] being the left operand.
in_ports.name: IN[2]

types.name: int/greater

out_ports.description: True if value received on port IN[0] is greater than value received on port IN[1].
out_ports.name: OUT

types.description: Check if an int is greater than or equal to other.

in_ports.description: Two ports for greater-or-equal comparison operation. Indexed from 0 to 1, and IN[0] being the left operand.
in_ports.name: IN[2]

types.name: int/greater-or-equal

out_ports.description: True if value received on port IN[0] is greater than or equal to value received on port IN[1].
out_ports.name: OUT

types.description: Check if an int is less than other.

in_ports.description: Two ports for less comparison operation. Indexed from 0 to 1, and IN[0] being the left operand.
in_ports.name: IN[2]

types.name: int/less

out_ports.description: True if value received on port IN[0] is less than value received on port IN[1].
out_ports.name: OUT

types.description: Check if an int is less than or equal to other.

in_ports.description: Two ports for less-or-equal comparison operation. Indexed from 0 to 1, and IN[0] being the left operand.
in_ports.name: IN[2]

types.name: int/less-or-equal

out_ports.description: True if value received on port IN[0] is less than or equal to value received on port IN[1].
out_ports.name: OUT

types.description: Check if an int is different from other.

in_ports.description: Two ports for not-equal comparison operation. Indexed from 0 to 1
in_ports.name: IN[2]

types.name: int/not-equal

out_ports.description: True if value received on port IN[0] is different from value received on port IN[1].
out_ports.name: OUT

in_ports.description: Value to be constrained.
in_ports.name: IN

members.description: Range values (min, max, step). Used only if use_input_range is disabled.
members.name: range

members.description: Use min, max and step values from package instead of options min, max and step. It's useful if you need to convert from many different sources to the same range and all of them inform these values correctly in each package.
members.name: use_input_range

out_ports.description: Value constrained considering range
out_ports.name: OUT

in_ports.description: Data input port.
in_ports.name: IN

out_ports.description: Outputs the same variable as the input if it's in range, nothing otherwise.
out_ports.name: OUT

members.description: if true, the packet irange will have it's min and max changed to the min and max of this node.
members.name: range_override

types.description: check if value is between a min and max range.

in_ports.description: value that will be checked if its in range or not.
in_ports.name: IN

types.name: int/inrange

out_ports.description: true if IN is in range
out_ports.name: OUT

in_ports.description: Value to be converted.
in_ports.name: IN

members.description: Input's range. Used only if use_input_range is disabled.
members.name: input_range

members.description: Use min and max values from input package instead of option input_range. It's useful if you need to convert from many different sources to the same range and all of them inform these values correctly in each package.
members.name: use_input_range

out_ports.description: Value mapped considering input and output ranges
out_ports.name: OUT
